comment.author: 44124458380@N01
comment._content: This was most likely between 1910 and the Dreamland fire in May 1911.

comment.author: 33168467@N00
comment._content: amazing photos. so glad i discovered this.

comment.author: 32981092@N02
comment._content: These types of scenarios remind of the movies, it's amazing that not that long ago shows like this actually existed right here in America. I hear so much about Coney Island, and to see it in what might have been its prime is a great treat.

comment.author: 14841959@N06
comment._content: Added to the gallery, More Oddities From the Commons.

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: I did a little research and found info on Ferari and added it to Wikipedia: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseph_G._Ferari

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: Richard Arthur Norton:  Thanks!  We'll include Ferari's info. in the description next time we update.

comment.author: 25100796@N08
comment._content: I question whether the gent in the photo is Ferari.  Animal trainers of the era would have worn military-inspired uniforms.  I rather think the fellow may have portrayed a "wild man" of some description.
